intro: Anadendrum calcicola, commonly known as the limestone bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. This plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found on limestone soils. Its small, yellow flowers are typically clustered in racemes, and it produces distinctive, inflated seed pods. Anadendrum calcicola is adapted to withstand drought and has a slow growth rate, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
